block.p: ''We need the first green president,'' Friedman says. But we would be selling ourselves short to suggest that we never had a president who was concerned about protecting the environment. We've had earth-conscious presidents from the start. To quote George Washington on crop management: ''Nothing in my opinion would contribute more to the welfare of these states than the proper management of our lands.'' And it was only 30 years ago that we had our most green president, Jimmy Carter, leading the way to reduce our oil usage. We need to get our green groove back.
